Package camzup.core

Class Mesh3

java.lang.Object
camzup.core.EntityData
camzup.core.Mesh
camzup.core.Mesh3
All Implemented Interfaces:
IEntityData, IMesh, IUtils, java.lang.Cloneable
public class Mesh3
extends Mesh
Organizes data needed to draw a three dimensional shape using vertices and faces. Given that a mesh is primarily a collection of references, it is initialized with null arrays (coordinates, texture coordinates and indices). These are not final, and so can be reassigned.

  • Field Summary

    Fields 
    Modifier and Type Field Description
    Vec3[] coords
    An array of coordinates in the mesh.
    int[][][] faces
    The faces array does not include face data itself, but rather indices to other arrays which contain vertex data.
    Vec3[] normals
    An array of normals to indicate how light will bounce off the mesh's surface.
    Vec2[] texCoords
    The texture (UV) coordinates that describe how an image is mapped onto the geometry of the mesh.

  • Field Details

    • coords

      public Vec3[] coords
      An array of coordinates in the mesh.

    • faces

      public int[][][] faces
      The faces array does not include face data itself, but rather indices to other arrays which contain vertex data. It is a three-dimensional array organized by
      1. the number of faces;
      2. the number of vertices per faces;
      3. the information per face;
      2D meshes contain two pieces of information per vertex: spatial coordinates and texture coordinates.

    • normals

      public Vec3[] normals
      An array of normals to indicate how light will bounce off the mesh's surface.

    • texCoords

      public Vec2[] texCoords
      The texture (UV) coordinates that describe how an image is mapped onto the geometry of the mesh. Typically in the range [0.0, 1.0].

  • Constructor Details

    • Mesh3

      public Mesh3()
      The default constructor.

    • Mesh3

      public Mesh3​(int[][][] faces, Vec3[] coords, Vec2[] texCoords, Vec3[] normals)
      Creates a mesh from arrays of faces, coordinates, texture coordinates and normals. The mesh's arrays are set by reference, not by value.
      Parameters:
      faces - the faces array
      coords - the coordinates array
      texCoords - the texture coordinates array
      normals - the normals array

    • Mesh3

      public Mesh3​(Mesh3 source)
      Constructs a copy of the source mesh.
      Parameters:
      source - the source mesh

    • Mesh3

      public Mesh3​(java.lang.String name)
      Creates a named mesh.
      Parameters:
      name - the mesh name

    • Mesh3

      public Mesh3​(java.lang.String name, int[][][] faces, Vec3[] coords, Vec2[] texCoords, Vec3[] normals)
      Creates a named mesh from arrays of faces, coordinates, texture coordinates and normals. The mesh's arrays are set by reference, not by value.
      Parameters:
      name - the mesh name
      faces - the faces array
      coords - the coordinates array
      texCoords - the texture coordinates array
      normals - the normals array

    • cube

      public static Mesh3 cube​(Mesh3 target)
      Generates a cube mesh. In the context of Platonic solids, also known as a hexahedron, as it has 6 faces and 8 vertices.
      Parameters:
      target - the output mesh
      Returns:
      the cube

    • dodecahedron

      Parameters:
      target - the output mesh
      Returns:
      the dodecahedron

    • fromObj

      public static Mesh3 fromObj​(java.lang.String[] lines, Mesh3 target)
      Creates a mesh from an array of strings. This is a simple obj file reader. It assumes that the faces data of the mesh includes texture coordinates and normals. Material information is not parsed from the file, as Processing would not accurately recreate it.
      Parameters:
      lines - the String tokens
      target - the output mesh
      Returns:
      the mesh

    • icosahedron

      public static final Mesh3 icosahedron​(Mesh3 target)

      Returns:
      the icosahedron

    • plane

      public static final Mesh3 plane​(int cols, int rows, Mesh3 target)
      Creates a plane subdivided into either tris or quads, depending on the polygon type. Useful for meshes which later will be augmented by noise or height maps to simulate terrain.
      Parameters:
      cols - number of columns
      rows - number of rows
      target - the output mesh
      Returns:
      the mesh

    • plane

      public static final Mesh3 plane​(int div, Mesh3 target)

      Parameters:
      div - subdivisions
      target - the output mesh
      Returns:
      the plane

    • calcNormals

      public Mesh3 calcNormals()
      Attempts to recalculate the normals of this mesh per vertex. If the normals array is null, or if its length is not equal to the length of coordinates, the normals array is reallocated.
      Returns:
      this mesh
